comment._content: Yep, Tantilla as well as Tiny Town Bowling Alley, which shared the building.

comment.author: 8333148@N03
comment._content: Did the Tantilla have a ceiling that rolled back to open to the night sky?  "Dance under the stars"?

comment.author: 73626679@N03
comment._content: Not exactly,bowling & pin-ball below,dancefloor on top!Many grat performers such as the "Platter's" played there.One of the last venues was "The Classics Four",had a date with a girl that "Dennis Yost" was about to fall of the stagewhile serenading her!

comment.author: 73986319@N02
comment._content: My father played trumpet in a band at Tantilla Gardens nightly for 8 months running during 1947. He assures me that the ceiling to that establishment did indeed crank open to reveal the night sky, and that patrons literally were able to dance beneath the stars. At some point Tantilla Gardens discontinued opening up the ceiling. I'll see if he knows when and why.
